snippet: Should the extraction process receive final approval, a likely outcome would be to allow some hydrofracking along the Pennsylvania border.
abstract: New York State Health Department analysis prepared in early part of 2012 and kept closely guarded by the Cuomo administration apparently concluded that drilling technology known as hydrofracking could be done safely with proper precautions; environmentalists worry that administration's lack of transparency is hiding a lack of rigor in its assessment of public health risks; state officials say analysis, which was revealed to New York Times, is out of date.
lead_paragraph: Should the extraction process receive final approval, a likely outcome would be to allow some hydrofracking along the Pennsylvania border.

headline.seo: Hydrofracking Safe, Says N.Y. Health Dept. Analysis
headline.main: Gas Drilling Is Called Safe in New York
headline.print_headline: Gas Drilling Is Called Safe In New York
